messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "stixwix00" <stixwix@h...> wrote:
> I am wondering if there is a 'standard' way to have a report of what
> testsuites/test methods JUnit has run and the test results.
> I had a quick look at the Junitreport Ant task but ideally don't want
> to run the tests from Ant, and anyway, its not obvious to me how to
> proceed with this approach.
> Others speak of Maven but that may be overkill...

Have you considered running Junitreport directly from Java? I haven't
tried it myself, but I've run other Ant tasks outside Ant itself. You
would need to set "Anty" properties such as the Project appropriately,
but that shouldn't be too hard.

Alternatively, rip out the guts of Junitreport (in
XMLResultAggregator.java, btw) and use it directly. More work in the
short term, but easier to use in the longer term.

There may well be other alternatives, of course - but I've used
Junitreport with great success. (I've modified the transforms involved
to cope with the idea of "ignored" tests, as we convert NUnit reports
to a JUnit XML format first.)

Jon
